message_1:
Consider the sets A = {1, 2, 3, 4} and B = {3, 4, 5, 6}. Find:
1. A ∪ B (the union of A and B)
2. A ∩ B (the intersection of A and B)
3. A - B (the difference between A and B)
4. B - A (the difference between B and A)
message_2:
1. A ∪ B (the union of A and B) is the set of all elements that are in either A or B or both. So, A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}.

2. A ∩ B (the intersection of A and B) is the set of all elements that are in both A and B. So, A ∩ B = {3, 4}.

3. A - B (the difference between A and B) is the set of all elements that are in A but not in B. So, A - B = {1, 2}.

4. B - A (the difference between B and A) is the set of all elements that are in B but not in A. So, B - A = {5, 6}.
